cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 785 mi ESE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW then bending NW, slowing and aiming toward the North Carolina/South Carolina coastline before stalling inland toward the western Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Cape Fear area of North Carolina (close to the NC/SC border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of the North Carolina/Virginia border to Cape Charles Light, including Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from South Santee River SC to Duck NC (south of the port)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coasts of South Carolina, North Carolina, and southeastern Virginia including the lower Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) are possible; hurricane-force winds are unlikely but cannot be ruled out should the track shift northward.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4+ ft of surge is possible in the lower Chesapeake Bay and adjacent tidal rivers if the storm’s center stalls south of the region.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands associated with Florence could exceed 4 inches with localized higher totals, bringing flash-flood risk to Hampton Roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and coastal erosion are expected ahead of and during the storm.
